Body: The liquidity of the tokens will be provided from day one by our liquidity smart contract, created on the Bancor Protocol technology. We plan to start the exchange listings with Ether-delta, and have initial plans also for Binance, Hit-BTC and quite a few other bigger players, who we can not announce now.

Author: BitRewardsTeam
Title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê[ANN][PRE-ICO][BitRewards | Blockchain rewards and loyalty platform]‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Body: Here's a question from one of the promintent persons in the cryptocurrency, our answer and his response. You might find it interesting:  Q: From what I was able to find on your project - a few obvious questions arise. Which network will be handling the vast majority of the transactions and how would you address the scalability issue that would be an obvious problem for any rewards solution on blockchain (wich are plenty right now, none have solved this issue last time I have checked with them).  A: Thank you for the question. We also consider the network scaling as one of the major roadbocks to quite a few projects that have emerged recently.  Short answer:  We will move the vast majority of transactions off from the Ethereum blockchain. In the beginning, we'll process them in a centralized manner; later we will switch to Raiden / Lightning networks or other blockchains.  Long answer:  Using Raiden network will allow authorizing the settlements of the transactions on the Ethereum platform almost instantly. We will adapt our software to make use of the Raiden network as soon as it's released. Now it's 80% ready, according to their official GitHub ‚Äî https://github.com/raiden-network/raiden/milestones.  While the Raiden network is still under development, we have the following plan: 1. In the beginning, we will make a half-centralized software, when the shoppers will get their BIT rewards in a centralized manner (our web wallet). The balance in that wallet will not depend on Ethereum blockchain; it will be controlled by our proprietory software and database. However, when someone wants to withdraw their total reward to the external crypto wallet ‚Äî their balance will be recorded to Ethereum blockchain, and they will receive actual ERC20 tokens. We know from experience that only a small minority of people will withdraw tokens often because most people use the default solution and don't care so much.  2. If the Raiden network is still under development in August 2018, we will consider using ¬µRaiden (https://github.com/raiden-network/microraiden) to make the system more decentralized, as ¬µRaiden will help to reduce fees of transfers between shops and shoppers.  3. If there will be no good news about Raiden network in November 2018, we will consider moving the tokens and the entire system to another blockchain. We are closely looking at Ripple or NEM, which are both attractive from different perspectives suits. If we decide to move this way, we will implement an atomic cross-chain exchanger to move all the tokens to the new blockchain. It is a complex, but a realistic process.

The IP on the platform and the tools is owned by our mother company, www.giftd.tech, and our lawyers are planning the activities for transfer of IP rights and registration of patents to BitRewards starting from the first quarter of 2018. We also hold some AI-related patents, which will be used in the BitRewards tools. Looking forward to your further questions and comments.

Title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê[ANN][PRE-ICO][BitRewards | Blockchain rewards and loyalty platform]‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Body: We followed Incent when it emerged, because we monitor the rewards software space, as it's our core business for the last 5 years.  The principles of BitRewards are similar, however what‚Äôs different about us is that we haven‚Äôt just started up this project on the crypto hype.  We‚Äôve been working with e-commerce small and medium-sized businesses for five years, run a profitable SaaS in loyalty and service several hundreds of online stores helping them boost their revenue double digit percentages.  We have dozens of products within our suite of tools, and BitRewards came about as an extremely valuable, but just one more tool, which will allow us to expand our target audience by the order of magnitude, because we can offer it free of charge.  We seriously doubt that it‚Äôs possible to start up a loyalty company from scratch, without knowing the industry and making successful products solving the real clients‚Äô problems.  If you're interested in our current business, you may visit our website https://giftd.tech/en/.  You may also want to try out our live product demo, which emulates the cryptocurrency payout and will soon run on our test crypto token, before the real BIT token issuance occurred: https://crm.giftd.tech/app/ydoMbTBAev  Sign in to see future BIT tokens payout in action.  We are polishing it's cryptocurrency functions now and will make it available on our website soon.  Note that this is not just a demo or some MVP. It's a working product, compatible with popular e-commerce CMS. It has rich API ‚Äî https://crm.giftd.tech/api/docs/en/ and it's ready to work for shops.

Body: Business model   BitRewards Network profits from the growth in value of the BIT token, therefore it provides basic customer software and apps for the retailers free of charge. Although it will be possible for the developers of the Smart Rewards apps within the BitRewards ecosystem to charge the merchants for the customary tools, the BitRewards will not take commission from transactions, aiming to provide maximum efficiency to the merchants.  More: https://bitrewards.network/wp.pdf

Author: BitRewardsTeam
Title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê[ANN][PRE-ICO][BitRewards | Blockchain rewards and loyalty platform]‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Body: Thank you for your question.  We would spend no more than 25% of funds on product development. It's possible because our product is based on existing software (as we work on this market for almost 5 years). We will re-use many of software pieces that we've already built. However, lots of stuff has to be projected, designed, developed and maintained.  What about other 75%? Short answer: scaling and marketing. Since our token's exchange rate is a primary source of revenue for us, we will push the market hard  to create a great demand on token.   And softcap is too big, i suppose.  The stated softcap will allow us to reach the optimal number of retailers connected to BitRewards. "Optimal" here means min. 5'000 retailers in 3 years. This will create min. $5'000'000 monthly demand on our token. And this in turn leads to min. 5'000% token's price growth rate from this moment.

Title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê[ANN][PRE-ICO][BitRewards | Blockchain rewards and loyalty platform]‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Body: Every year millions of retailers spend in excess of $20 billion on software that improves the loyalty of their customers. They need to do that in order to stay competitive in the current crowded marketplace. Loyalty programs are not only costly, but also time consuming and cumbersome to set up. Often times, customers get only more frustrated from participation in them, complaining about difficulty to earn points or bonuses and to redeem them. This results in a fact that most loyalty programs just don‚Äôt pay themselves off, and shut down in less than 12 months time.  You can read more in our ¬´White Paper¬ª:  https://bitrewards.network/wp.pdf
